description.narrative: (i) Supporting microfinance: The Project will help support an institution that provides financial services to the underserved regions of Guatemala by providing it with stable and diversified funding to expand its operations, enchanced capacity and increased outreach; (ii) Demonstration effects: The Project will demonstrate the attractiveness of a commercial microfinance institution as many standalone entities are NGO-backed; the Company''s success should encourage best practices and the development of a broader array of microfinance products; (iii) Enhance financial access: in a number of frontier regions in Guatelama with large indigenous populations; (iv) Poverty reduction through entrepeneurship.

The proposed investment consists of a 5-year local currency Parallel Loan for up to US$15 million (US$7.5 million from IFCs own account) to support Compartamos S.A. ("Compartamos GT" or the Company) in growing its loan portfolio in Guatemala. Proceeds from the credit line will be utilized by Compartamos GT to increase and diversify its funding base - currently a greenfield purely funded by equity - by obtaining medium-term funding for on lending to small and micro enterprises in Guatemala.

name.narrative: Compartamos GT is headquartered in Quetzaltenango, Guatemala where the management team is based. Its operations span 15 offices across 5 Guatemalan states (as of September 2012), which the Company plans to grow during 2013 and 2014. Investments will be made in rural areas with limited access to financial services given Compartamos GTs business model; additionally the Company would serve more than half of Guatemalas frontier regions.
